comment: Young wood aroma, almost like cedar
Big in flavor. Hint of vanilla and spices. Awesome for cocktails, preferred neat!

As much as I want to like this because it's a local micro, it's just too young and too harsh. There's some decent character so maybe in years to come with extra barrel aging it will mature into a fine bourbon. For now not worth the price.
Get a decent amount florality... roses?
Smooth. Very floral flavor. Didnt like as much
Agree that it doesn't have much depth but with a chew it has a good flavor. Kinda like the young taste.  All in all not really worth the price. Tastes like $30.

Got to sample this bourbon, notes of spices, vanilla, sweet and a heat that rises up to my nose and maybe a little smoke. Certainly doesn't have the smoothness associated with an age statement. Grows on me the more I drink of it. I'm certainly glad I got to try it but needless to say I won't be buying a bottle
Ok. Not blowing the roof off. But ok.
Young but a fun and spicy

Young distillery and living in Evanston at the time had to give this a try. You can tell it hasn't aged much as it isn't that complex, but I agree in that good things may be ahead from FEW with older bourbons down the road.
Aggressive nose up front. Sweet and cinnamon burn. Apple pie?
Rye heavy and young. I'll pass.
Les amateurs de whiskey irlandais risque de bien aimer. Le gout du malt y est très présent.
Very smooth, fruity finish. Great flavor.
Lots or cornbread in the nose and tongue, big finish
Very peppery. Good to sip alone, but stands up well in a mix.
Very grain-forward. The nose was very "scotchey" to me. One of the stranger tasting bourbons I've had. Not hard to drink though. I guess I'm tasting the youth of the bourbon.
Absolutely terrible.  Avoid at all costs.

Hard to fault ambition - but this is not good a good advert for bourbon. Bottle opening-no overpowering traces other than you can smell the alcohol. Taste- very thin, artificial and a vague after taste of metal.One star for effort. One star for the packaging. It's hard to think of a  seemingly more calculated effort to make something artisan. Dissappointing.
A little watery at first, comes on strong at the end with no burn.  Good sipping Whisky.
Very spicy start and lingering burn. Not my first choice

i really wanted to like this one.  especially at its 55.00 price point. they use a really pretty and expensive looking bottle that makes you think you are getting your money's worth.  unfortunately, i have to say the flavor profile is very flat and lacks any semblance of complexity.  it tastes like a cheap 1 year old bourbon or perhaps a vodka with some interesting notes.  it would be a steal at 12.00/bottle.  i wish i could say i liked it.  this just seems like a company jumping on bourbon band wagon with no intention of producing a good product.  in summary, this product is overpriced crap.  pretty bottle, high price point, cheap product.  don't waste your money. if you wan't something from outside of Kentucky that has value,  go buy a bottle of Widow Jane instead.  They should be shot for this desecration of the spirit variety.   there are lots of brands of bourbon in this price point that have value.  this one.....does not.
Rye forward and very spicy. Not what you typically think do a bourbon to taste like, but fantastic none the less.

Color: light Amber like corona 
Nasal: unaged booze, basil, and evergreen
Uncut: white pepper and lemon
Cut:pine
Nose - caramel, big vanilla, milk chocolate. Taste - Honey, vanilla, chocolate, almond. Best of the flight.

On sale at Byerly's/SLP, at about $35, so I had to give a try, since it has been on my wishlist for a while. I liked the first glass a lot: very surprised since I'm Ky biased. Very spicy and up front. Second tasting, not as exciting: not as impressive somehow. Jury is still out for me.
Complex. Solid caramel aftertaste. Relatively smooth.

Lots of fresh, lightly toasted barrel on the nose. The taste follows suit, but doesn't come across as with as much oak as you would anticipate. Smooth sipper, but lacks the darker, caramel/chocolate notes I prefer

A lot of great things come out of the state of Illinois.... wait no they don't and whiskey is no exception. I've had two whiskeys from Illinois in the past week and all I can say is blah. The nose was the best part with oak vanilla citrus cedar spearmint and nutmeg. Wood spice at the forefront and flavors hard to pick out. Very thin and unflavorful if you just drink it, you literally have to chew on it. After that you get the floral/ citrusy notes as well as some cinnamon and apple like flavors. Lightly smoky/ charred flavor and maybe some dark honey with a little mintiness but its all hard to pick out and very bland. Finish is longish smoky sweet alcohol and more oak

16 - bon bourbon 
pas de fautes
vanille - épices - assez complexe 
bonne longueur en bouche
leather, pine? aromas, fruity at first, then deeper wood flavor, a little warm spice, rich
Caramel and vanilla and a little bit fruity, very smooth
Very standard bourbon taste. Great on the rocks. Would buy again
Powdered detergent and caramel on the nose.  Taste is a bit soapy, but also very sweet caramel and anise.  Finish is oaky and sweet.  Barnyard-y.

Some cherry and charred oak on the nose, with faint apples and spice on the tongue. The finish is dry and long. 

Not bad, but there are much better choices out there.
Broader mouthfeel than the Rye. Tasty.
Tasty at first, but felt a little flat after the initial taste. Definitely willing to try other expressions though!
the mellowest bourbon I've had by a huge margin. not sweet at all, which is a huge boon for me. alcohol smell and burn. flavorful not overwhelming
Pretty tasty pour for craft bourbon. Upon entry you get rich caramel and brown sugar. Baking spices on the mid pallate with a short vanilla and slight oak finish. 3.5/5.
Being from Chicago, I really want to like this, but just don’t.
4 years ago. ok, not great, iodine and heat. maybe they've gotten better with age.
Initially thin and sweet changes quickly to spicy mildly astringent taste with some fruit. Light woody finish.
For only 46.5% this bourbon packs a real kick. More barrel time could help maybe?

2.5 stars

Solid bourbon, but not at the price.
3.75. Sweet and fruity taste. Hard to smell because of glass and location.
Smooth , spicy, gentle , sweet chili jam
Had in old fashioned. Nice pepper note but quickly leave pallets warmth all the way down.  Smooth will be drinking this straight next time.
Fairly flat flavor profile. Got some burn to it, but no strong pleasant tastes... just a lingering alcohol flavor. Strong clove near the end. Wouldn't pay more than $25.

Whoa. This needs to be drank on the rocks. There is so much going on here. Too much, honestly. It's a bourbon, but with loads of rye in it as well. It's a weird mash-up that makes the taste really busy.

Hairspray, bourbon, strong smell. Sip one: hairspray, corn, peanuts, peanut butter, popcorn. Lots of flavors in this one. Very sweet aftertaste. Sip 2: more of the same. I’d like this one if it didn’t have the peanuts and peanut butter. Sip 3: overall, not a bad experience.

Advent Calendar 2018
Day 20

Barb liked it; I thought it was good too

Deep amber iced tea color in the glass with long sticky legs. 
Nose: not overly sweet or vanilla-like. Spicy, with lots of woody oak and some char. 
Palate: moderately sweet and savory, with some candy corn and vegetal notes both in the background, sparring for attention amidst the oaky and somewhat earthy notes. 
Finish:  moderately long with pleasing heat, commensurate with its ABV. 
Nice dram overall. I’d give it a good B+.  For those critical of bourbon for being too sweet, this is a balanced, savory dram that doesn’t overwhelm with sweetness.

I really enjoyed this bottle till the last drop.. it is very unique, unlike most bourbons .
Lots of spice some corn , you can tell it is young but that is what makes it interesting.. I will replace my bottle

Nose : Anise, candy cane, leather, rye heavy, black pepper, oak.
 Taste:. More oak on the taste along with the rye spice, cherry.  Very solid dram that's not just a plane Jane Bourbon.

The starts sweet with peach and apple, along with rye and caramel that is mostly gentle, but does have an underlying spiciness. The palate starts with oak and caramel along with strong rye spiciness that starts off rich and full but gradually turns dry. The finish is medium with fading rye and fruits. Fairy simple to drink.
Very sweet smell. vanilla and oak with some faint rye. Sweet taste up front that turns a little spicy on the finish
sweet up front, not much oak, tastes lightly wheated
Bitter, not a smooth finish - but well aged.
Caramel forward neat.  Dry finish.  Spicy... cinnamon maybe?  Rye?  Slightly sweet.
Nose is nice but a bit fleeting. Smooth start with a tart finish, maybe a bit of green apple. Not bad, but not memorable.
Very young tasting. Let it sit a couple of weeks after opening. It gets a little better.
Liked a lot. Good flavors, not much burn

Nose: Dirt, pear, apple, dry bread crust.

Taste: dried fruits, pepper, cola burn but without the sweetness. 

Experience: snacking on a bag of dried fruit  on a hot summer day driving down a dusty road. 
I can't get my head around just how dusty and farm-like this whiskey is, the high rye keeps it from feeling like most bourbon but it doesn't taste like a rye that much either. I would love to see what a few more years does to this.
Sweet corn comes through at first but the finish is dry and spicy from the high rye. Young bourbon.

Color is a rich, light caramel. A bit of spice in the nose but is dominated by acetone. Flavor is fairly oaky with spice. Very dry finish. Hint of dark fruit. Tastes fairly young and in line with many "craft" Bourbons I've had trouble warming up to.
Initial taste of black licorice and dirt
Still too young and harsh for my liking

So sweet. Cherries and honey. Maybe caramel but it's way in the back. Smoooooooth finish. Kinda "melty." Like a melted version of the cherry/honey nose. Not very hot, relatively speaking. Cinnamon callback. Real good.

A very enjoyable ride. It starts sweet on the tongue, very soft at first, almost feels like it's gonna let you down, but then it builds into this mid-palate character of dry oak, brown sugar, light cherry, continuously building spice until it almost feels hot, but then finishes with a long lingering soft oak and baking spice. It leaves the mouth dry. I can see how people think this is boozy, but if you like a strong bourbon, this will not be challenging at all. It's good.
Cherry, peanuts, ethanol and musty corn on the nose, slightly spicy and semi-sweet palate with some cherry, hint of spice and cherry on the medium finish.
While young, I really liked it.

Not sure why so many people seem to hate this, I really enjoyed the last bottle I had as did a friend, it was somewhat sweet and smooth but it stood out in multiple blind taste tests for me, always finishing in the top two

1 cube of ice. Nose of earth and spice that is very powerful and forward. Starts slow but develops with hints of spice with a very slight medicinal hint. Surprisingly complex bourbon out of Illinois and a welcome addition to the bourbon world.
Spicy earthy with a sweetness at the end
